DataElement.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Agent Quantity Start Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Time IV contrast is injected.  Time is recorded in military format, e.g. 1:00 pm = 1300 hrs.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The measured amount of radiography substance that allow visualization of certain tissues injected into a blood vessel.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: Quantity; how much there is of something that you can measure.

Concepts.definition: How much there is of something that you can measure; the total amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc  12/28/09 released for VCU FLT 8029 study.  2/11/08 - revised property for better reflect amount of tracer. 12/28/07- Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The point at the beginning of time (recorded in military format) when fluids or drugs are push into the body via use of a syringe and needle.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Use of a syringe and needle to push fluids or drugs into the body; often called a "shot.":Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense.:the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: Administration of a drug into a location within the body; this can be achieved either through an established access or via a needle.
Have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense; the point in space or time where something begins.
The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

ValueDomain.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
ValueDomain.changeDescription: 10/14/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent PET modality CSI. jc  3/5/08 - released for UoWASH FES CRF.  2/26/08 revised max/min to 4/4 to harmonize with other military time VDs for ACRIN PET CDEs.  12/20/07 revised to remove radiotracer which is captured in DEC.  10/3/07 - created to support ACRIN PET CDE curation

DataElement.origin: ACRIN:American College of Radiology Imaging Network
DataElement.changeDescription: 10/13/13 Removed caBIG-ACRIN CSI; added equivalent ECOG-ACRIN CSI. jc  12/28/09 released for VCU FLT 8029 study.  1/3/08- Created to support curation of ACRIN PET CDEs
